intro: Senecio saboureaui, commonly known as the Cape Hottentot, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It features narrow, gray-green leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Senecio saboureaui is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
